title: Securiy Policies
description:
The policies engine allows you to write custom sets of policies that are validated during requests, responses, or token validation.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/service-settings/security-policies/

req.title: Request policies
req.description:
All the policies applied in the request context.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/service-settings/security-policies/

policies.title: Policies
policies.description:
An array with all the policies to evaluate. Each policy is represented as a string

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/service-settings/security-policies/

items.title: The policy you want to evaluate

body.title: Error body
body.description:
Leave an empty string to return the validation error, or write a string with the error response body. You can add escaped JSON, XML, etc in the string and add a Content-Type.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/service-settings/security-policies/

status.title: HTTP status code
status.description:
The HTTP status code you want to return when the validation fails.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/service-settings/security-policies/

content_type.title: Content-Type
content_type.description:
The Content-Type header you'd like to send with the error response. When unset, uses `text/plain` by default.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/service-settings/security-policies/

resp.title: Response policies
resp.description:
All the policies applied in the response context.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/service-settings/security-policies/

jwt.title: JWT policies
jwt.description:
All the policies applied in the JWT context (token validation). Any policy failing will generate a `401 Unauthorized` error. Works in `endpoint` context only.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/service-settings/security-policies/

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/service-settings/security-policies/

items.title: The policy you want to evaluate

disable_macros.title: Disable advanced macros
disable_macros.description: Advanced macros can be disabled in those policies not needing them for a faster evaluation.

debug.title: Debug
debug.description: When true, all the inputs and evaluation results are printed in the console.

auto_join_policies.title: Auto-join policies
auto_join_policies.description: When true, all policies of the same type concatenate with an AND operation to evaluate a single expression. Performs faster, but its harder the debug.
